SEARCH
Module project.miniproject3
Package project.miniproject3.model.ships

Interface IShip

All Known Implementing Classes:
AShip, Carrier, Destroyer, Frigate, Submarine
public interface IShip
Interface that defines the structure of a ship in the game. A ship is characterized by its span, shape, and orientation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    javafx.scene.Node
    getShape()
    Returns the shape of the ship, represented by a JavaFX Node.
    int
    getSpan()
    Returns the span of the ship, which is the number of cells the ship occupies on the board.
    Boolean
    isHorizontal()
    Returns whether the ship is horizontal or not.
    void
    setHorizontal(boolean horizontal)
    Sets the orientation of the ship.

  • Method Details

    • getSpan

      int getSpan()
      Returns the span of the ship, which is the number of cells the ship occupies on the board.
      Returns:
      the span (size) of the ship

    • getShape

      javafx.scene.Node getShape()
      Returns the shape of the ship, represented by a JavaFX Node. The shape can be used to render the ship on the game board.
      Returns:
      the shape of the ship

    • setHorizontal

      void setHorizontal(boolean horizontal)
      Sets the orientation of the ship. The ship can either be horizontal or vertical.
      Parameters:
      horizontal - true if the ship is horizontal, false if it is vertical

    • isHorizontal

      Boolean isHorizontal()
      Returns whether the ship is horizontal or not.
      Returns:
      true if the ship is horizontal, false if it is vertical
